function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Increasing reliance on digital technology for essential services","Impact":"Dependency on technology for vital services can lead to disruption in case of technological failure or cyber attacks.","Mitigation":"Developing redundant systems, regular security audits, and staff training for cyber security.","Technologies":"Redundant systems, cybersecurity measures, staff training for cyber security","People":"General public, government, healthcare providers","Owner":"Technology companies, government, healthcare organizations, cybersecurity firms"},{"Description":"Legal and ethical constraints of deploying emerging technology for disease surveillance and control","Impact":"Ethical and legal issues can lead to public distrust and opposition, hindering disease surveillance and control efforts.","Mitigation":"Compliance with privacy regulations, transparency in data collection and use, and engagement with ethical and legal experts.","Technologies":"Privacy-enhancing technologies, data transparency tools, ethical and legal assessment platforms","People":"General public, government agencies, technology developers","Owner":"Government, technology developers, legal and ethical experts"},{"Description":"Risks of accuracy, safety, protection, and data quality in disease surveillance and control technologies","Impact":"Inaccurate data, safety hazards, and data breaches can lead to ineffective disease surveillance and control measures.","Mitigation":"Regular quality assessments, safety testing, data encryption, and privacy protection measures.","Technologies":"Quality assessment tools, safety testing protocols, data encryption technologies","People":"General public, healthcare providers, government agencies","Owner":"Healthcare organizations, government agencies, technology developers"}]}
